meanings.definition: Inclined to or conducive to slumber.
meanings.sent1: The soft music created a slumberous atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent2: The cozy bed looked so slumberous after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The slumberous cat stretched lazily in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The slumberous haze of the afternoon made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent5: The slumberous scent of lavender filled the air, lulling me to sleep.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or suggestive of slumber.
meanings.sent1: The slumberous silence of the house made me feel peaceful.
meanings.sent2: The slumberous expression on his face indicated he was about to doze off.
meanings.sent3: The slumberous clouds drifted lazily across the sky.
meanings.sent4: The slumberous stillness of the night enveloped the town.
meanings.sent5: The slumberous warmth of the fireplace made everyone drowsy.

meanings.definition: Inducing or tending to induce slumber.
meanings.sent1: The slumberous lullaby sung by the mother put the baby to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The slumberous effects of the medication made him drift off quickly.
meanings.sent3: The slumberous motion of the rocking chair calmed the child.
meanings.sent4: The slumberous rhythm of the rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The slumberous comfort of the blanket wrapped around her was irresistible.
